sourceMeaningMnemonic: You use the <radical>power</radical> of your <radical>mouth</radical> to spit <radical>shellfish</radical> at people as a form of <kanji>congratulations</kanji>! In fact, you yell "CONGRATULATIONS!" as the shellfish come pouring out of your powerful mouth.
meaningInfo: Shellfish were once used as currency, so this totally makes sense. Just think of the shellfish as money coming out of your mouth as you say your congratulations.
readingMnemonic: When you say <kanji>congratulations</kanji> like this, you look just like a <reading>ga</reading>rgoyle (<ja>が</ja>). You're crouching down, your mouth wide open, just like a stone gargoyle.
readingInfo: The next time you're congratulating someone, assume the gargoyle stance and dump all of their congratulatory shellfish on them from your mouth.
